snippet: The league posted its constitution, which had long been confidential, on its website while it seeks to require Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers.
abstract: NBA posts its constitution, which had long remained confidential, on its website as it seeks to force Donald Sterling into selling the Los Angeles Clippers; document shows that Sterling's future will hinge on Article 13, which outlines circumstances under which ownership can be terminated; remains unclear how rules will affect Sterling's wife Rochelle, who co-owns team through trust and has pledged to keep control.
lead_paragraph: The league posted its constitution, which had long been confidential, on its website while it seeks to require Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers.

headline.main: Rare View Into Inner Workings of N.B.A.
headline.print_headline: Sterling Case Puts Murky Rules in Focus as N.B.A. Reveals Constitution
